text.p: The following are leading domestic stories in Portuguese newspapers.
- The total value of the state sickness subsidy dropped 9.9 percent year-on-year to 6.7 billion escudos.
- Portuguese road transport companies asked foreign insurance companies to cover losses incurred in the transport of goods as a result of the French truckers' strike.

- Despite the French truckers' strike, Opel, Ford and Citroen factories have sufficient supplies to maintain production until tomorrow. Any decision to reduce or halt production will depend on events in France.
- Casino workers received seven billion escudos in tips between 1993 and 1995, according to official data from the General Inspectorate for Gaming.

- Publicity time on Portuguese television rose 16 percent in the 12 months to the first quarter 1996. Total advertising time per day on the four Portuguese TV channels is about 11 hours. The growth in advertising revenues over the same period has not kept up with the growth in TV advertising time in Portugal.
- "Lisbon's OSCE summit (on December 2-3) will be a unique opportunity to create a unified Europe," Russian Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin told the paper in an interview.
- Communist Party accuses the defence ministry of creating databases containing data on crime without any regulatory controls.
